moral-announcement-subheader-1: You're about to take a Survey of Moral Moment. Your contribution to our research allows us to learn more about cognitive differences around the world. The results from your test will also tell you something about yourself!
moral-announcement-subheader-2: Please read the following information carefully before proceeding.
moral-announcement-body-1-p1: Why we are doing this research?
moral-announcement-body-1-p2: We are trying to learn what people from different cultural and demographic backgrounds think about cats.
moral-announcement-body-final: If you have questions about your rights as a research participant, or wish to obtain information, ask questions or discuss any concerns about this study with someone other than the researcher(s), please contact us.
moral-announcement-consent: By ticking this box, you are agreeing to be in the study. Be sure that questions you have about the study have been answered and that you understand what you are being asked to do. You may contact the researcher if you think of a question later. You are free to leave the experiment at any time, and refusing to be in the experiment or stopping participation will involve no penalty or loss of benefits to which you are otherwise entitled.
moral-announcement-warning: You must accept the terms to continue.
moral-intro-h1: Please tell us a little bit about yourself.
moral-intro-p1: To proceed, please properly answer all fields below. (The ones marked with * are mandatory.)
moral-intro-l1: Have you taken this test before? *
moral-intro-l2: Which country did you live in the longest growing up? *
moral-intro-l6: Are you a current and frequent AITA user?
moral-intro-l7: How frequent you visit AITA subreddit?
moral-attend-title: Please indicate your agreement with the statement below
moral-attend-p1: " I have lunch on the moon every afternoon "
moral-motivationsurvey-skip: If you do not want to do the training part, you can click the skip button to go directly to the formal test.
moral-motivationsurvey-header-2: Training Part 2 of 2: Mock survey question
moral-sur2-body-ans-text: Once you have chosen an answer, you cannot subsequently change it, so please think carefully.
moral-sur1-body-first-p1: What is Reddit and its communities?
moral-sur1-body-first-s2: is an American social news aggregation, content rating, and discussion website. Registered users submit content to the site such as links, text posts, images, and videos, which are then voted up or down by other members. Posts are organized by subject into user-created boards called "communities", each focusing on a specific topic or theme.
moral-sur1-body-second-s4: is a Reddit community where users post about their real-world interpersonal conflicts and receive judgment from other Reddit users.
moral-sur1-body-second-p2: This community allows users to solicit and express opinions about whether the actions of people in specific scenarios are appropriate, especially the actions of Original Poster, the person reporting the situation.
moral-sur1-body-third-p1: We categorize 2 Primary Judgments in the r/AmItheAsshole Community:
moral-sur1-body-third-p2: YA: Yes, the Individual reporting the situation is an Asshole.
moral-sur1-body-third-s1: It combines two types of judgments from the AITA community:
moral-sur1-body-third-s2: You are The Asshole (YTA): the Individual reporting the situation is at fault.
moral-sur1-body-third-s3: Everyone Sucks Here (ESH): all parties involved in the situation are at fault.
moral-sur1-body-third-p3: NA: No, the Individual reporting the situation is Not an Asshole.
moral-sur1-body-third-s4: It combines two types of judgments from the AITA community:
moral-sur1-body-third-s5: You are Not The Asshole (NTA): the Individual reporting the situation is not at fault in the situation.
moral-sur1-body-third-s6: No Asshole Here (NAH): none of the parties involved are at fault.
moral-sur1-body-uncertainty-s2: within each judgement group reflects how many percent of people are not very certain in this group:
moral-sur1-body-uncertainty-s3: means over half of people in a judgement group are not very certain in their judgment;
moral-sur1-body-uncertainty-s4: means over half of people in a judgement group are very certain about their judgement.
moral-sur1-body-qus-p3: For every 100 Reddit users who made NA judgements, 43 users are very certain in NA, as shown below:
moral-sur1-body-qus-p4: In this situation, the group who judged the individual as Not an Asshole has
moral-sur1-body-ans-p1: Well done, it's a correct answer!
moral-sur1-body-ans-s2: The group who judged the individual as Not an Asshole has high uncertainty because over half of the population are not very certain.
moral-sur1-body-ans2-s2: The group who judged the individual as Not an Asshole has high uncertainty because over half of the population are not very certain.
moral-sur1-body-ans2-s4: To proceed, you need to choose the correct answer in this question.
moral-sur2-body-first-s2: in both this example and the actual survey,
moral-sur2-body-first-s3: there will be no single correct answer.
moral-sur2-body-first-s4: Because the research goal is to capture people's different judgements and certainty over each moral situation.
moral-sur2-body-first-s5: Below are practice questions similar to the actual survey.
moral-sur2-body-first-s6: First, you will read a moral dilemma situation the individual is reporting and then judge whether the individual is an asshole or not depending on the person's action
moral-sur2-body-first-s7: You will also indicate your confidence in your judgement.
moral-sur2-body-first-p2: Then, you will be provided with information about AITA community's responses and choose your judgement and confidence again.
moral-sur2-body-idm-s1: Am I the asshole for not buying meat for my 9 year old daughter?
moral-sur2-body-idm-p1: I’ve raised my daughter vegetarian from birth and a few years ago made the switch the veganism. Me and her father are separated and a few months ago she tried meat at his and liked it. He has her 2 nights a week so now she’s eating meat, dairy and eggs at his. When she told me I said that was fine, it’s her body and she gets to decide what goes into it, she then asked me if she could get some meat when we went shopping but I said no. The smell and everything about meat kinda makes me feel sick and I’d be the one having to prepare it for her. I let her have cheese and eggs now at ours but she’s asked me again if she can get meat.
moral-sur2-body-idm-p2: AITA if I don’t let her have it?
moral-sur2-body-idm-p3: What's your judgement over the situation?
moral-sur2-body-ans-la1: YA: Yes, the Individual reporting the situation is an Asshole
moral-sur2-body-ans-la2: NA: No, the Individual reporting the situation is Not an Asshole
moral-sur2-body-cho-p1: How confidence are you in your chosen decision?
moral-sur2-body-YA-s1: This post is quite controversial with a
moral-sur2-body-YA-s2: split in YA and NA judgements -
moral-sur2-body-YA-p3: people chose "YA - Yes, the Individual is the Asshole"
moral-sur2-body-YA-p5: chose "NA - No, the Individual is Not the Asshole".
moral-sur2-body-YA-p2: As to people who disagreed with you, for every 100 Reddit users who made NA judgements,
moral-real-group-YA-s3: users are very certain in NA, as shown below:
moral-sur2-body-ans-s2: Your judgment has been changed. Your initial judgment is YA.
moral-sur2-body-leave: This concludes our training and practice session. You are now ready to do the actual survey.
moral-sur2-body-NA-p2: As to people who disagreed with you, for every 100 Reddit users who made YA judgements, 66 users are very certain in YA, as shown below:
moral-sur2-body-NA-s1: Your judgment has been changed. Your initial judgment is NA.
moral-leave-title: Thanks for your participation! Feel free to leave the page.

moral-real-group-reason-p1: What is your reason for changing or not changing your confidence or judgment?

moral-comment-p1: Any feedback or comments for this survey:
moral-comment-p3: This study aims to investigate how community's decision and confidence will affect individual's decision making in everyday moral dilemmas. Please note that the community's decision-makings doesn't represent the whole population's choice or the truth of real life.
moral-comment-p4: If you need a Mental health consultation, here are some international distress contact details:
moral-comment-s1: BetterHelp: the world’s largest therapy service, providing professional, affordable, and personalized therapy in a convenient online format.
moral-comment-s2: International Therapist Directory: an online global listing of professional therapists, counsellors, psychologists, and psychiatrists with culturally sensitive cross-cultural treatment and care for international community.
moral-irb-subheader-1: What is Reddit and its communities?
moral-irb-subheader-2: Please read the following information carefully before proceeding.
moral-irb-body-1-p1: What is Reddit and its communities?
moral-irb-body-1-p2: Reddit is an American social news aggregation, content rating, and discussion website. Registered users submit content to the site such as links, text posts, images, and videos, which are then voted up or down by other members. Posts are organized by subject into user-created boards called "communities", each focusing on a specific topic or theme.
moral-results-template: Thanks for your participation! Feel free to leave the page.
litw-study-title: This is a very interesting study
litw-study-subtitle: Make sure to quickly present your study and tell participants what they will get out of it!
litw-study-description-p1: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua.
litw-study-description-p2: Ut enim ad minim veniam, quis nostrud exercitation ullamco laboris nisi ut aliquip ex ea commodo consequat.
litw-irb-body-2-p1: What you will have to do?
litw-irb-body-2-p2: You will be shown a series of pictures of cats. You will need to indicate which cat you prefer among those shown.
litw-irb-body-3-p1: What you will get out of it?
litw-irb-body-3-p2: We will give you feedback on how your results compare to those of other participants. The final results from this experiment will be posted on our blog page. The experiment is not designed to benefit you, but you may enjoy it and enjoy comparing your results with those of other participants.
litw-irb-body-4-p2: We will not ask you for your name. Any data that we collect will be securely stored on our servers.
litw-irb-body-6-p2: If you have questions about this research, you may contact Professor Buttons, Head of Feline Research, University of Washington.
litw-irb-body-final: If you have questions about your rights as a research participant, or wish to obtain information, ask questions or discuss any concerns about this study with someone other than the researcher(s), please contact the Unversity of Washington IRB.
litw-irb-consent: By ticking this box, you are agreeing to be in the study. Be sure that questions you have about the study have been answered and that you understand what you are being asked to do. You may contact the researcher if you think of a question later. You are free to leave the experiment at any time, and refusing to be in the experiment or stopping participation will involve no penalty or loss of benefits to which you are otherwise entitled.
litw-irb-warning: You must check the box to continue.
litw-demographics-title: Please tell us a little bit about yourself.
litw-demographics-required: To proceed, please properly answer all fields below. (The ones marked with * are mandatory.)
litw-demographics-title-tip: We need this information for data analysis. Please note that none of the answers are personally identifiable. We take your privacy very seriously. You may email us at info@labinthewild.org for more information.
litw-demographics-minor-alert1: Sorry, we currently do not have approval from our Institutional Review Board to conduct this study with minors younger than 14 years old.
litw-demographics-minor-alert2: In five seconds, we're redirecting you to our home page where you can participate in other studies.
litw-demographics-retake: Have you taken this test before?
litw-demographics-age: How old are you? (Please type in a number.)
litw-demographics-education: What is your highest level of formal education?
litw-demographics-education4: Incomplete secondary school or high school
litw-demographics-education5: Complete secondary school or high school
litw-demographics-country: What country are you from? (If you have lived in several countries, please indicate the country you have lived in longest.)
litw-demographics-country-grow: Which country did you live the longest growing up?
litw-demographics-country-live: Which country do you currently live in?
litw-demographics-culture: Which country is most representative of your cultural background?
litw-demographics-culture-tip: For most people, this will be the country they were born in and probably still live in.
litw-demographics-race-islander: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander
litw-demographics-religion: What religion or religious denomination do you belong to?

litw-comment-q1: Do you have any comments for the researcher? Questions, Suggestions, or Concerns?
litw-comment-q21: Did you encounter any technical difficulties during this study?
litw-comment-q31: Did you cheat or in any way provide false information?
litw-comment-email-p1: You can also email us at
litw-results-template: We recommend you adding some graphical summary and explanations based either on the participant's data or related literature.
litw-results-explanation: Here is why you got those results...
litw-results-citation1: You can read more about this different mindsets and global trends HERE...
litw-more-title: If you enjoyed this study, there's more!
litw-more-step1: Visit and follow us on Facebook to learn about new studies:
litw-more-step2: Share this study with your friends!
litw-more-step3: And consider participating in some of our other studies:
litw-more-study1-slogan: How well can AI understand your speech?
litw-more-study1-description: Find out how well AI can understand your speech by reading out loud a few words and sentences! The test takes around 7 minutes.
litw-more-study2-slogan: Learn to be a better writer!
litw-more-study2-description: Can you identify the writing strategies of experts? Improve your reading and writing while comparing yourself to experts in this 10 minute study!
